item.title: Man tried to save wife and son from drowning in Loch Lomond
item.description: Waris Ali tells the BBC that the water at the end of Loch Lomond pier had "looked very safe".

item.title: GB win three golds on 'Magic Monday'
item.description: Day three of the Tokyo Olympics was 'Magic Monday' for Team GB with three golds - for divers Tom Daley and Matty Lee, swimmer Adam Peaty and Tom Pidcock in mountain biking.

item.title: Whipps Cross Hospital patients evacuated after flooding
item.description: "Major incident" at Whipps Cross Hospital as fire brigade takes 1,000 flood calls across London.

item.title: Bernadette Walker: Scott Walker guilty of murder
item.description: Scott Walker murdered Bernadette Walker, 17, and her mother Sarah helped cover up the killing.

item.title: Lockdown weight gain averaging half a stone - survey
item.description: Four in 10 adults in England have become fatter during the pandemic, a survey suggests.

item.title: Dieter Brummer: Home and Away actor dies aged 45
item.description: Brummer famously played Shane Parrish - Melissa George's love interest on the TV soap in the 1990s.

item.title: High Court climate bid dismissed against projects including Stonehenge tunnel
item.description: Campaigners say the ruling is deeply worrying for "anyone hoping for urgent action on climate".

item.title: Joey Barton denies assaulting his wife Georgia
item.description: The Bristol Rovers manager allegedly left his wife with a head injury in an attack in Kew, London.

item.title: Ronan Keating accepts phone hacking damages
item.description: The ex-Boyzone singer's lawyers told the High Court of the distress caused by newspapers stories.

item.title: Ian Paterson: Plans for further breast surgeon compensation
item.description: A further 5,500 patients of Ian Paterson have been identified since he was jailed.

item.title: Wayne Rooney reports photos to Greater Manchester Police
item.description: The images appear to show the ex-England footballer asleep with unknown women posing beside him.

item.title: Pink offers to pay bikini bottoms fine for Norway women's handball team
item.description: The Norway women's side were last week fined for wearing shorts instead of bikini bottoms in a match.

item.title: Standon Calling festival-goers make most of mud as heavy rain hits
item.description: Organisers of the festival call it off due to flooding and risk of lightning.

item.title: Canterbury Cathedral stained glass is among world's oldest
item.description: New research indicates that stained glass windows from Canterbury Cathedral may be among the oldest in the world.

item.title: London flooding: When a month of rain fell in one day
item.description: From blocked roads to flooded homes, the deluge of rain has caused huge disruption to the capital.

item.title: Deadly street protests over Iran water shortages
item.description: Khuzestan is one of the country's hottest regions, where temperatures can reach 50C.

item.title: The new surgical tool inspired by a wasp
item.description: The device avoids clogging by using friction instead of suction, similar to the way a parasitoid wasp lays its eggs.

item.title: The Making of Tom Daley
item.description: Olympian Tom Daley looks back at the moments that have shaped his life and career.

item.title: The repair team preserving an 18th Century home
item.description: Meet the people who work to keep Dennis Severs' 18th Century house in Spitalfields open.

item.title: The repair shop trying to fix throwaway culture
item.description: A social enterprise has opened up shop in Glasgow to encourage communities to repair and reuse their possessions.

item.title: Unesco adds Madrid's Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park to heritage list
item.description: The famous Paseo del Prado and Retiro Park are symbols of the Spanish capital's history.

item.title: Could Covid vaccine be taken as a pill?
item.description: Researchers are looking at easier ways for people to get the vaccine, including via inhalers and tablets.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: One athlete braved sharks and crocodiles
item.description: Training for the Olympics can be a full-time job but Jo Brigden-Jones has combined it with much more.

item.title: Why remote working leaves us vulnerable to cyber-attacks
item.description: Experts warn working from home has led to complacency over security protocols

item.title: Covid-19: Recent claims about cremations and vaccines fact-checked
item.description: Debunking claims shared widely on social media about cremations in the UK and US vaccine statistics.

item.title: Covid: 'I earned less, but spent the same'
item.description: A new Couch to Financial Fitness programme aims to help people organise their finances post-pandemic.

item.title: 'You'd walk out if your husband hit you - you can't when it's your child'
item.description: Parenting a violent child is a traumatic experience, and one that is often hidden from view.

item.title: The experiences replacing closed High Street stores
item.description: Go-karts, bowling alleys and eateries have taken the place of closed retailers on the High Street.

item.title: Excitement over wooden shipwreck found in Antigua's seabed
item.description: Historians believe the wreck found in Antigua to be the 1762 Beaumont, a French merchant ship.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Daley and Matty Lee take diving gold - highlights
item.description: Watch highlights as Tom Daley ends his long wait for an Olympic gold medal with a sublime display alongside Matty Lee in the men's synchronised 10m platform.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Lauren Williams wins silver in -67kg taekwondo
item.description: Great Britain's Lauren Williams takes silver in the -67kg taekwondo at Tokyo 2020 after being beaten by Matea Jelic of Croatia in the final.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: Sign up for the BBC Sport app
item.description: With latest scores and headlines sent straight to your device, personalisation and much more, ensure you have a great sporting life with BBC Sport.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB's Tom Pidcock wins gold in mountain bike cross-country
item.description: Team GB's Tom Pidcock puts in a brilliant ride to win an Olympic gold medal in the men's mountain bike cross-country at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty becomes two-time Olympic champion - immortality next?
item.description: Adam Peaty won 100m breaststroke gold on Monday to become a double Olympic champion - and there's plenty more to come from the Briton.

item.title: Tom Daley: The boy with the Olympic dream that came true
item.description: The 'baby' of Beijing became a father, a husband and an LGBTQ+ spokesperson. And now Tom Daley is an Olympic gold medallist. This is his story.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Adam Peaty, Tom Daley & Matty Lee and Tom Pidcock win gold for GB on 'Magic Monday'
item.description: Adam Peaty, Tom Daley & Matty Lee and Tom Pidcock win gold as day three in Tokyo becomes 'Magic Monday' for Team GB.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ariarne Titmus' coach Dean Boxall goes wild following her 400m freestyle win
item.description: Watch the wild celebrations of the coach to Australian swimmer Ariarne Titmus after she wins a thrilling 400m freestyle gold at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics medals table
item.description: Medals table for the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Pidcock wins mountain bike gold for GB
item.description: Great Britain's Tom Pidcock claims Olympic gold in the mountain bike cross-country - two months after breaking a collarbone.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Daley and Matty Lee win gold in men's synchronised 10m platform
item.description: Britain's Tom Daley wins a first Olympic gold medal as he claims victory alongside Matty Lee in the men's synchronised 10m platform.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Alex Yee wins silver in men's triathlon as Kristian Blummenfelt takes gold
item.description: Great Britain's Alex Yee wins silver in a punishing men's triathlon at the Tokyo Olympics as Kristian Blummenfelt of Norway claims gold.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Momiji Nishiya wins skateboarding gold at just 13
item.description: At the age of 13, Japan's Momiji Nishiya wins the first-ever Olympic gold medal in women's street skateboarding.

item.title: Watch: Peaty powers home in 100m breaststroke
item.description: Watch Adam Peaty create history by becoming the first British swimmer to retain an Olympic title with gold in the 100m breaststroke at Tokyo 2020.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Boat causes false start in men's triathlon
item.description: Watch the bizarre moment a boat holds up the start of the triathlon at the Toyko 2020 Olympics.

item.title: Covid rules: What has changed?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules have taken effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: All over-18s can now get the Covid jab, but the government has criticised take-up among young people.

item.title: Covid: Who has to self-isolate, which workers are exempt and what if I'm fully vaccinated?
item.description: A small number of named employees in key sectors will be exempt from some rules

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: Covid vaccines: How fast is progress around the world?
item.description: Charts and maps tracking the progress of Covid vaccination programmes.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's adult population, as more than 46 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Fully jabbed adults don't have to self-isolate after visiting amber-list countries - except France.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the NHS test-and-trace system and app work?
item.description: The contact tracing app could be changed to make it less sensitive, so it sends fewer alerts.

item.title: Care homes worst hit by Covid – search the data
item.description: Figures from Care Quality Commission lay out the pandemic's 'devastating impact' on care homes in England.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Tokyo Olympic Games: When are they and how will Covid affect them?
item.description: The Tokyo Summer Olympics have begun, despite a surge in Covid cases in Japan.

item.title: Covid symptoms: Is it a cold or coronavirus?
item.description: With similar symptoms, deciding whether or not you need to get tested for coronavirus can be tricky.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: Why is social distancing coming to an end?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Vaccine experts recommend that a limited group of children should be offered Covid jabs ahead of winter.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England will have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.
